content:
If your TB was installed from the MS Store, the profile is not in the same place as the profile with a standard TB install. That might be why MailStore can't find prefs.js. Note also that the store profile isn't found through the links in Help/Troubleshooting Info, which is a bug.

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1434631

content:
Prova con queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non √® risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si √® ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Propriet√† -> [Ripara la cartella]

creator: owner14

content:
Se quando hai disinstallato Thunderbird non hai cancellato il profilo, reinstallando Thunderbird dovresti ritrovare tutta la tua posta. Cerca per√≤ di installare la stessa versione che avevi prima.

Inoltre fai prima un backup del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird

A titolo di informazione: anche se una mail contiene un virus, il particolare metodo con cui Thunderbird salva la posta rende il virus inoffensivo a meno di aprirlo deliberatamente.

content:
The free to download and use Thunderbird product does not have a direct ticket support system here as only the subscription based products do like for example Mozilla VPN. Perhaps you posted in the wrong product section by accident in looking for Thunderbird support help.

In your other thread you think this is a ticket system when it is a thread in the Thunderbird product support section of this community support forum https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/ as you can see other threads for Thunderbird at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/thunderbird?show=all

Anyways you have a thread going at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1469177
creator: James

content: Als u IMAP gebruikt om uw e-mail te synchroniseren kunt u proberen uw account te verwijderen en opnieuw toe te voegen. Aangezien bij IMAP berichten op de server blijven staan worden ze daarna opnieuw gesynchroniseerd en zou het goed moeten komen. Overigens worden berichten niet echt verwijderd als u op ‚ÄòVerwijderen‚Äô klikt; ze worden in de Prullenbak geplaatst. Maak regelmatig uw Prullenbak leeg om de ruimte die deze berichten op de server (bij IMAP) of uw computer (bij POP) innemen beperkt te houden.

content:
Much appreciated, but removing 'Saved Passwords' and creating new profile didn't resolve problem. Still unable to send messages. Any fix coming in the near future? No change noted with last Thunderbird update just a few days ago, even with correct server settings and modern OAuth2 authentication clearly in place.

See uploaded image with requested screenshot of authentication error message.

Considering continued difficulty encountered by myself and others with outgoing email, is this an unresolved bug known to Mozilla that was worsened by Microsoft's Sept 16th pullback of suport for basic authentication?

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/outlook_com/forum/all/outlook-problems-from-september-16-2024/fe0bfac8-d0d6-4fd6-bf06-06e9aa89919a

Presumably a genuine security risk, but just trying to better understand, is it also not effectively blocking all competing third-party email apps like Thunderbird? Any insights?

creator: su6864

content:
Windows has the ability to do that, but my fingers always get confused in doing it, so I prefer using dedicates apps to create screenshots. Two free ones are these:

  1. https://www.bluefive.pairsite.com/downloads.htm the app is 'snapshot', very small. install it, start it, click 'capture' menu, then click 'capture rectangle area', drag mouse to highlight desired area, and then click save. Really easy.
  1. https://picpick.app/en/ the website impiies a fee, but it's free for personal use. This is a bigger app, but it can do much more.

The reason that screenshots are preferred is that doing such ensures that everything is visible.

content: I suggest experimenting a bit. using port 25 with no authentication is rare today, as email hosts want more security. I would try a few combinations, such as port 587 and STARTTLS, or 465 and SSL/TLS and use 'normal password' for authentication. No guarantees, but I have seen many users having success with their email hosts by trying other settings. Let me know what error messages you receive for the combinations.

creator: rswenson

content: If by 'Yes' you mean the jumping screen happens in safe mode, then it can't be caused by an add-on, since add-ons are disabled in safe mode. If you mean that the problem disappears in safe mode, it's possibly caused by an add-on, or more likely by hardware acceleration being enabled in normal mode (it's disabled in safe mode).

content: I created a new event in my Google calendar and invited attendees by adding them in the Invite Attendees window (see picture), OK, then clicked Send & Close in the New Event window. The attendees received a notification email, since the Notify Attendees box was checked in the initial New Event window. When I deleted the event, a cancellation message was automatically sent to the attendees. This is all done with a calendar added to TB with the built-in CardDAV option. So, I'm not sure what your issue is, except maybe there is no confirmation that invitations have been sent, or no message in the Sent Mail folder.

content:
Ronald Richard said
I could not find a specific area to submit suggestions.

It is linked on Thunderbird help menu. Four items below Get help which takes you to this forum.

I know nothing of alexa, and as I have moral issues with Amazon and it's owner, I probably never will. But for the two to communicate there needs to be an ical server that serves alexas calendar. Although I understand from google search that you can integrate Icloud, Outlook.com and Google calendars into the Amazon product and Thunderbird interacts with those. So perhaps you need to use one of them as a calendar linked to alexa, not the amazon product directly.
